cough.symptom: Frequent coughing, especially with no known cause
cough.prevention: Avoid smoking, minimize exposure to secondhand smoke, and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
cough.meal_plan: Focus on fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. Limit red and processed meats.
cough.advice: Regular check-ups are crucial. Monitor any changes weekly.

persistent cough.symptom: Cough that persists over several weeks
persistent cough.prevention: Avoid irritants and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
persistent cough.meal_plan: Focus on a balanced diet rich in vitamins and minerals.
persistent cough.advice: Consult a doctor if cough persists for over a week.

shortness of breath.symptom: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
shortness of breath.prevention: Avoid smoking and exposure to pollutants.
shortness of breath.meal_plan: Consume anti-inflammatory foods like leafy greens, berries, and nuts.
shortness of breath.advice: If symptoms worsen, seek medical advice.

blood in stool.prevention: Regular screenings, high-fiber diet, and regular exercise.
blood in stool.meal_plan: Incorporate more fruits, vegetables, and whole grains to aid digestion.

unexplained bruising.prevention: Avoid exposure to harmful chemicals and radiation.
unexplained bruising.meal_plan: Eat a balanced diet rich in vitamins, especially vitamin C and iron.
unexplained bruising.advice: Track bruising patterns and consult a specialist.

abdominal pain.prevention: Maintain a balanced diet, limit alcohol intake, and avoid smoking.
abdominal pain.meal_plan: Focus on easily digestible foods and avoid fatty foods.
abdominal pain.advice: Seek medical advice if pain persists or worsens.

night sweats.prevention: Boost immunity through a healthy diet and regular exercise.
night sweats.meal_plan: Consume immune-boosting foods like garlic, ginger, and green tea.
night sweats.advice: Consult a healthcare provider if this is a new or persistent symptom.

fever.prevention: Avoid infections by practicing good hygiene and maintaining a balanced diet.
fever.meal_plan: Incorporate hydrating foods like watermelon, cucumbers, and broths.
fever.advice: Seek medical evaluation for recurrent fevers.

fatigue.symptom: Chronic fatigue or lack of energy
fatigue.prevention: Limit exposure to radiation and chemicals. Eat a balanced diet.
fatigue.meal_plan: Emphasize foods rich in iron and vitamins, such as leafy greens and nuts.
fatigue.advice: Rest is vital; monitor fatigue levels weekly.

mild tiredness.message: This symptom alone is unlikely to indicate cancer. However, monitor if it persists or worsens.
mild tiredness.meal_plan: Focus on nutrient-dense foods and proper hydration.

digestive discomfort.symptom: Temporary digestive issues, such as bloating or gas
digestive discomfort.message: This symptom may be due to diet or lifestyle factors. If persistent, consider a dietary adjustment or consult a healthcare provider.
digestive discomfort.meal_plan: Include probiotics, fiber, and avoid trigger foods.

no_severe_symptoms.message: Based on your inputs, no signs of cancer were detected. It's still advisable to maintain regular health check-ups and a healthy lifestyle.
